Subject: We are looking for a way to block attachments in different ways via outlook.
Description:
I believe we are missing a concept or a method on how this done.

We are looking to block email attachments to free emails like gmail and only whitelist in specific domain users within our company to be able to email attachments out that way.

When we went to do this via Denylists, in the email tab, it couldn't be added to CAP, it seems to be a global. Is the Denylists area the only place to do this? We are not looking to block attachments everywhere, only in places related to say like listed domains ex 'gmail', and only allow specific people, like that of HR.

Thank you kindly for time and consideration.
What_We_Know__c:
5/27/2025

- Sent customer email following up to see if he has further questions
Solution_Comment__c:
- Customer requested to block email attachments to free email services (e.g., Gmail) while allowing only specific business domain users to send attachments.
- Informed customer that Endpoint Protector does not currently support this exact configuration.
- Provided a workaround: restrict access to Gmail, Google Drive, and Google Docs to only approved business accounts.
- Guided customer to navigate to Content Aware Protection > Deep Packet Inspection > Deep Packet Inspection Ports & Settings.
- Instructed to select "Gmail" in the "Select Parser" dropdown.
- Explained how to add allowed business domains under "Allowed Domains for Google Business Accounts" and save changes.
- Noted that any Google domain not listed will be blocked from accessing Gmail, Google Drive, and Google Docs.
- Provided example and screenshots for reference.
- Advised customer to reach out with any further questions.
- Customer requests to close case
